title: Add a check for strings disguised as leading zeros followed by numbers
body:
Closes #179.

According to the YAML 1.2 spec (https://yaml.org/spec/1.2/spec.html#id2761292) numbers sequences with a leading zeros (that are not special encoding identifiers such as 0x, 0b, etc) are actually strings.

This patch handles this case, all existing tests still pass.

title: bump linked hashmap to min 0.5.3
body:
linked_hashmap has an unsound behaviour which was fixed 0.5.3. Bumping the dependency so that dependents do not pull the lower unsound versions based on resolution. 

[Advisory](https://github.com/RustSec/advisory-db/issues/298)

Side note: yaml_rust is affected as well ([pr] https://github.com/chyh1990/yaml-rust/pull/162) so that dependency will have to be updated when they release as well.

title: Update readme code samples to not fail assert
body: Closes #161. This has been broken since #88.

title: Added initial fuzzing setup.
body: Initial fuzzing setup for integration with OSS-Fuzz. The fuzzer setup is inspired by [rust-fuzz](https://github.com/rust-fuzz)

title: Only accept finite values from f64::from_str
body: Upon closer inspection of #156, we were incorrectly producing negative nans (and also infinities) through f64::from_str which were not supposed to be YAML nans or infinities.

title: YAML only has two NaNs
body: There is only `.nan` and `-.nan`. Update the PartialEq impl for Value to align with this; for example we shouldn't allow building a YAML map with multiple `.nan` keys having different bit representations.

title: Run clippy on latest nightly that has clippy
body: Previously, it would run on the most recent nightly always, and simply skip Clippy if it wasn't available in that nightly.

title: Value == u64
body: The comparison of unsigned integers as `i64` was last touched in #62 (Apr 21, 2017) and `as_u64` as added in #64 (Apr 25, 2017), explaining why the unsigned integers didn't compare as `u64` in the first place.

title: Value == bool
body: `Number` and `String` values can be compared, so why not `Bool`?

title: doc: give Value::as_mapping_mut example room to breath
Add seeded versions of deserialize functions.
body:
Allows usage of `DeserializeSeed` types.

The `T` parameters on `_seed` functions are required because it's not possible to extract `S::Value` out of the higher-rank bound without also specifying that for all `'de`, `S::Value` is indeed the same type.

title: Add Default implementation for Value
body:
Fixes #119 

This PR defines a default value for `serde_yaml::Value` struct.

title: Allow YAML tags to be used to specify an enum variant. Closes #115
128-bit integer support
body: i128 and u128 can now be serialized and deserialized.  Support is conditionalized on the disabled-by-default `i128` feature flag, and requires rustc 1.26.0 or later.  The minimum required version of Serde is now 1.0.60.

title: support binary format of integers, e.g. 0b0101
